pt: {sc}transient{/sc} {sc}transitory{/sc} {sc}ephemeral{/sc} {sc}momentary{/sc} {sc}fugitive{/sc} {sc}fleeting{/sc} {sc}evanescent{/sc} mean lasting or staying only a short time. {sc}transient{/sc} applies to what is actually short in its duration or stay.

pt.t: a hotel catering primarily to {it}transient{/it} guests

pt: {sc}transitory{/sc} applies to what is by its nature or essence bound to change, pass, or come to an end.
{sc}ephemeral{/sc} implies striking brevity of life or duration.
{sc}momentary{/sc} suggests coming and going quickly and therefore being merely a brief interruption of a more enduring state.

pt.t: my feelings of guilt were only {it}momentary{/it}

pt: {sc}fugitive{/sc} and {sc}fleeting{/sc} imply passing so quickly as to make apprehending difficult.

pt.t: let a {it}fugitive{/it} smile flit across his face

pt: {sc}evanescent{/sc} suggests a quick vanishing and an airy or fragile quality.

pt.t: the story has an {it}evanescent{/it} touch of whimsy that is lost in translation
